channel.title: Chapter 7: Pride on From Draenor With Love
channel.description: Recent content in Chapter 7: Pride on From Draenor With Love

item.title: And We Walked Out Once More Beneath the Stars
item.description: Almost exactly three years ago, we published the first page of our revamped From Draenor With Love. That was so long ago. That was before Warlords of Draenor was even announced! It‚Äôs kind of surreal to even think about. And now, 128 pages later, we‚Äôre drawing to a close. When we set out on this journey, we wanted to explore some themes that we both hold close to our hearts: friendship and family.

item.title: Under the Mid-Point of That Other Sky
Whose Shadow a Single Blow Pierced with Light
item.description: We‚Äôre a week into Legion, and all around me my guildies are talking about Suramar dailies, weird squid world bosses, reputation grinds, and other max-level concerns. Me, I‚Äôm still only level 107, so I‚Äôm just ignoring it all for now! Amusingly, somehow I‚Äôve reached 107 and finished only a single zone, Stormheim. Not via dungeon grinding, either! Just a lot of‚Ä¶meandering about, doing Darkmoon Faire quests, some pet battles, some Archaeology‚Ä¶everything but powerleveling, really.

item.title: The Ravening Beast
item.description: So how was everyone‚Äôs Legion launch experience? Me, I got myself trapped in the underbelly of an Alliance airship with no way out except for hurling myself out the open hatch to the sea below. Then I abandoned the breadcrumb quest into Stormheim to redo it and take more screenshots, but instead ended up stranded out there with no quests available. Then I hearthed back to Dalaran and broke my Tailoring profession quest by doing exactly the same thing.

item.title: Alone in a Dark Wood
item.description: Hey, nice job Kynrind on predicting the return of Vid‚Äôs symbol in the comments last week! üòÄ Yesterday was an interesting one in Azeroth ‚Äî Dalaran was completely missing! And even worse, if you had logged out there, when you logged in you fell to your death! Naturally, I had to do up a little bonus comic commemorating this bizarre moment (based on Kate Beaton‚Äôs original comic here.)

item.title: End of the Road, Part Six
End of the Road, Part Five
item.description: WRATHION NO So how about those Broken Shore and Demon Hunter cinematics?? Man, I sure wish we could get the cinematic team to do a FDWL version. üòâ

item.title: End of the Road, Part Four
End of the Road, Part Three
item.description: Can you really blame Wrathion? It‚Äôs not every day you see a fight like this. /popcorn

item.title: End of the Road, Part Two
item.description: cue Pacific Rim music Like it says, Page 5! A reveal 114 strips pages and almost 3 years in the making. Feels good, man.

item.title: End of the Road, Part One
item.description: SUSPENSE

item.title: BRB
item.description: I think Wrathion is my favorite character to write, especially because it‚Äôs so easy to imagine his voice saying the lines, since we heard him so much during Mists of Pandaria. Of course, it helps that his voice actor Aaron Phillips does hilarious things like read out fake Guy Fieri menus.

item.title: Full Circle
item.description: Back to Pandaria. Back to the Vale. It‚Äôs been a long road, but we‚Äôve finally come full circle. Big thanks to Poneria for being our latest Patreon patron! We really appreciate the support! üòÄ

item.title: Home Is Where the Hearth Is
Blinded By The Light
item.description: I have fond memories of using Blinding Light in arenas with Arcane Torrent, Rebuke, and Fist of Justice to just shut down enemy healers for an absurd amount of time. No wonder it got nerfed. Don‚Äôt forget to login soon to reclaim your free Warcraft movie transmogs! Even if you don‚Äôt plan on seeing the movie, the transmogs look great and should fit in well to anyone‚Äôs collection. üòÄ

item.title: The Power of Positive Thinking
item.description: Speaking of going back to Pandaria, I too have found myself back in Kun-Lai and Halfhill lately. Since Brawler‚Äôs Guild is going away in Legion, I‚Äôve been trying to get all the special quests to unlock the Brawler‚Äôs Guild challenge bosses required for Collect Your Deck ‚Äî partially for the achievement, but also for the shirts you get for beating those bosses. Gotta gear up for the wardrobe!

item.title: Filled With Determination
item.description: Vid sure has a lot to say this week! And I think most of us would tend to agree with much of what she‚Äôs saying. The Horde and Alliance really DO just keep screwing everything up, and both sides are too damn dumb to cooperate and play nice. After all, From Draenor‚Äôs entire whole story is about trying to fix one of our bigger blunders, and restoring the Vale. Sure, Garrosh might have been the one who did the deed, but let‚Äôs face it, Pandaria was doing pretty good on the whole ‚Äúcontrol the Sha by controlling your emotions‚Äù thing before we washed up on shore.

item.title: Together
item.description: COOL AS A CUCUMBER

item.title: A Warm Welcome
item.description: While this was definitely the appropriate Sha response, I can‚Äôt help but be tickled by the mental image of the Sha obediently following Khadgar‚Äôs silly arcane elemental all around Shattrath for like ten minutes, only to fail the quest at the very end because the elemental wandered out of sight or moved around a corner. Man, that quest sucks.

item.title: Destiny, Part 2
item.description: Well, maybe some things were simply meant to be.

item.title: Ding!
item.description: Level (page?) 100! Oh shoot, does this mean it‚Äôs time for LFR? Thanks to everyone who‚Äôs been reading FDWL over the years! We really appreciate the support, comments, and company we‚Äôve had along the way! üôÇ

item.title: Urgency
item.description: As we all learned in Warlords, operating without flight is a real drag. Too bad they don‚Äôt have Avianna‚Äôs Feather!

item.title: Eli‚Äôs Coming
item.description: (No, the Sha‚Äôs name isn‚Äôt Eli. It‚Äôs a song reference.) Sorry for the font change for the Sha, but I didn‚Äôt realize that the previous font would be‚Ä¶well, completely unsuitable for longer passages of text. I think this new look fits it pretty well, anyway! The Sha are such interesting enemies. We‚Äôve seen that they clearly thrive and draw strength from negative emotions, but at the same time, they‚Äôre obviously capable of corrupting creatures and people as well.

item.title: Outmatched
item.description: Being almost a full expansion past Mists of Pandaria, it‚Äôs easy to forget just how freaking creepy the Sha are! And their weird shadowy, void-like essence always did strike me as one of the more sinister forms of attack. Do they burn? Do they burn your spirit? Who knows!
